column4: Hi! I'm a new Ubuntu user. Can I get help installing SSH to mount remote folders locally?
when you say remote same network?
nope, a remote SSH server across the internet. I read that I could type "sudo apt-get install sshfs", but Ubuntu can't find the package.
sudo apt-get install openssh-server
I have the SSH server install that is the openssh one. Does it have what I need?
I never saw what you are looking at until now
let me find something
okay thanks. I use SSH all the time, but have never mounted remote drives locally.
you need to have the universe repos enabled
read the message from the bot ubotu please
I read it. It says to know that subpackages exist.
I will look for that package. Thank you.
have you got universe in there?
I'm not sure. The bot wants me to type !easysource
read that
I read what you sent to me, but the last one doesnt make any sense.
this one: http://www.ubuntulinux.nl/source-o-matic
I have told you already about iniverse if your not going to take my advice of that of others what are you doing asking
I wrote that /i read what u linked to but didnt understand it.. then u left
a pm in a moment for you
please click on the link in that pm
